paragraphs: The festival "Experience the City Differently" (Zažít město jinak 2025) will offer the residents of Prague a new perspective on their familiar urban life. Many streets and places, usually filled with cars, will be transformed into pedestrian zones for a day, featuring creative workshops, tables with various games, market stalls, and improvised terraces.
Any passerby can enjoy a cup of coffee, have a snack, have a good time, meet and chat with neighbors.
The festival will take place on Saturday, September 20, as part of the "European Mobility Week".
Participation is free. Everyone is welcome.
The Good Neighbor Festival will also offer Prague residents a variety of cultural and sports activities, such as street theater performances, dance classes, or fun sports competitions.
The event will take place for the twentieth time. It has been supported by almost all districts of Prague, each of which has prepared its own accompanying program.
👉 Detailed program is published on the event website.
"European Mobility Week" is an international campaign held annually from September 16th to 22nd in support of the environment.
Its participants are giving up personal cars in favor of bicycles, public transportation, and walking.
